title: 无互联网连接 Offline
content: offline                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Why not read poem  City C  P  CAVAFY TRANSLATED EDMUND KEELEY said   I ll go country  go shore  find city better one  Whatever try fated turn wrong heart lies buried something dead  long let mind moulder place  Wherever turn  wherever look  black ruins life  here  I ve spent so years  wasted them  destroyed totally   won t find new country  won t find shore  city will always pursue you  You ll walk streets  grow old neighborhoods  turn gray houses  You ll always end city  Don t hope things elsewhere  there s no ship you  there s no road  you ve wasted life here  small corner  you ve destroyed everywhere world  C  P  Cavafy   The City  C P  Cavafy  Collected Poems  Translated Edmund Keeley Philip Sherrard  Translation Copyright   1975  1992 Edmund Keeley Philip Sherrard  Reproduced permission Princeton University Press Source  C P  Cavafy  Collected Poems  Princeton University Press  1975
